description:
This market asks whether the Russian Federation will be stripped of or otherwise no longer hold its "permanent member" seat on the United Nations Security Council by April 30, 2022.

If the Russian Federation is stripped of or otherwise no longer holds its seat as a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) by April 30, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET (inclusive), this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the United Nations' list of Current Members of the UNSC, found here: https://www.un.org/securitycouncil/content/current-members, however other sources from the UN or credible media sources will suffice. If the primary resolution source from the United Nations is unavailable at resolution time it will be checked at 12:00 PM ET each day for 7 days following the resolution time. If the resolution source remains unavailable, other information from the United Nations or credible media sources will be used to resolve this market.

events.title: Will Russia have its UNSC permanent member status stripped by April 30, 2022?

question: Will Russia have its UNSC permanent member status stripped by April 30, 2022?
